title: Reeher Contributes to PolitiFact Piece on Number of Bills Gov. Hochul ...
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul claimed she had passed over 400 bills since becoming governor on August 24, 2021, a statement verified by PolitiFact. On average, 650 bills are enacted in New York each year among the thousands introduced. Professor Grant Reeher explained that several factors contribute to the large number of bills introduced in New York: the professional staff available to the legislature, the state's higher per capita spending compared to other states, and the extensive state government operations requiring legal adjustments. New York's active and liberal government spending also necessitates managing numerous programs through legislative measures.
snippet: In a recent campaign ad, Gov. Kathy Hochul said she passed more than 400 bills since she became governor on Aug. 24, 2021, a claim PolitiFact verified. Of the thousands of bills introduced in New York, an average of 650 are enacted each year. Professor Grant Reeher says there are several reasons for the large number of bills introduced in New York.

title: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul's Ad Claims She Signed More Than 400 Pieces ...
summary: New York Governor Kathy Hochul's advertisement claims she signed more than 400 pieces of legislation. However, according to a tweet by PolitiFact, she signed 585 bills from the time she became governor through early April.
snippet: New York Gov. Kathy Hochuls ad claims she signed more than 400 pieces of legislation. She signed 585 bills from when she became governor through early April. https://t.co/eM2T3NqiQa  PolitiFact (@PolitiFact) May 2, 2022

title: Gov. Kathy Hochul drops first ad of NY Democratic primary
summary: Governor Kathy Hochul released her first gubernatorial campaign ad ahead of the New York Democratic primary, following the resignation of her indicted lieutenant governor, Brian Benjamin. The ad, titled “Hard Work,” highlights Hochul’s efforts in reducing gun violence, cutting middle-class state income taxes, and her dedication to governance, having passed over 400 new bills. Benjamin resigned after being indicted in a bribery scheme involving illegal campaign donations. The ad campaign includes digital ads and a substantial broadcast TV ad purchase. Hochul faces a primary against US Rep. Tom Suozzi and Public Advocate Jumaane Williams, with polls showing her leading. If successful in the primary, she will likely face GOP front-runner Rep. Lee Zeldin in the general election.
snippet: April 19, 2022 12:15pm. Updated. ... Since taking office, shes passed over 400 new bills. ... hours after his indictment in an alleged bribery scheme involving more than $50,000 in ...

title: Since taking office, Hochul has passed more than 400 new bills ...
summary: Since taking office, Hochul has passed more than 400 new bills, as reported by Syracuse University News. Grant Reeher, a professor of political science at Syracuse University, was quoted in a PoliFact article to offer insights on why New York State frequently introduces and passes numerous bills. Reeher cited the state's liberal nature, active governance, high spending, and extensive management obligations as reasons for this legislative activity.
snippet: Grant Reeher, professor of political science and director of the Campbell Public Affairs Institute in the Maxwell School, was quoted in the PoliFact article Since taking office, Hochul has passed more than 400 new bills.Reeher, who studies American legislative politics, explained that there are many reasons that New York State in particular often introduces and passes so many bills.

title: Governor Hochul Signs Legislative Package to Combat Housing ...
summary: Governor Kathy Hochul has signed a legislative package designed to combat housing discrimination in New York State. This action responds to a Newsday investigation titled 'Long Island Divided' which uncovered discrimination in the real estate industry. The package includes nine bills aimed at strengthening fair housing laws. Key components include the establishment of the Anti-Discrimination in Housing Fund, increased fines for violators, the creation of a dedicated telephone line for discrimination complaints, and new mandatory training programs for real estate professionals on fair housing and implicit bias. The legislation obligates state and local agencies to promote fair housing actively and imposes standardized procedures on real estate brokers to ensure consistency and prevent discrimination. It reflects a concerted effort to address systemic inequalities and improve access to housing for all New Yorkers.
snippet: In Response to Newsdays Long Island Divided Expose, Governor Hochul Signs a Nine Bill Action Plan to Combat Housing Discrimination Establishes the Anti-Discrimination in Housing Fund to be Used by the Attorney Generals Office for Fair Housing Testing Establishes that All State and Local Agencies Have an Obligation to Further Fair Housing
